Fields.DialogueText: Phew. Hopefully that's the last hurdle between us and port.
Indeed. It's fortunate we didn't run into more trouble than we did with so few supplies left.
What's your take on crew morale?
Hungry, tired and grumpy, but they'll hold out. I’ve taken the liberty of holding a few extra prayer services in the chapel for those who wish it.
And our... free-spirited ship's spirit... how is she?
Ugh, what I wouldn't give for just a sandwich and a glass of--
Oh, Capitano, Lieutenant - ciao! Port soon, right? Aren't you glad?
I'll be in the crew mess if anyone needs me.
Pretty much like that.
Well, at least it doesn't seem to be hurting her effectiveness.

Fields.MenuText: I guess that's the important thing...
I don't know. Her morale contributes a lot to the crew's.
There's something more than that, surely.

Fields.DialogueText: As a practical matter, yes. But there's more than that.
That's true. Though, what contributes to hers?
I'm sure there is.
That's... something, coming from you.
... Captain, I know a lot of people find me... stern, prickly. Antoniotto and I have almost nothing in common. But I'm not heartless.
You know, in the Vatican they're debating the nature of Belles. I am at least certain that they have souls. And souls have needs... emotional, spiritual. Do you know hers? Does she?
Hmm.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I was told I'd find you up here on the bow deck. Nice sunset, isn't it?
Mm-hm.
We're cleared for service again, but they've restricted us to coastal patrol for at least a few weeks. Command is pretty miffed over the whole pirate thing.
Mm.
What have you got there?
Vin Santa Rosso. Vintage. Some of the crew bought it for me on shore.
And you're drinking it alone? That's not like you.
There's news in the port. A Fleet battle group chased some Morganas out of a wreckage field. Among the wreckage was the remains of Le Impitoyable... Gaspard's ship.
I don't mourn him, but... knowing they existed, even as an enemy, suddenly my dreams didn't seem so crazy.
Capitano, have I only been chasing fancy stories all this time? Dreaming of what can not or should not be?

Fields.MenuText: Gaspard was frankly lucky to survive these seas as long as he did.
It's hard when reality doesn't live up to the stories, isn't it?
You told me once that dreams were important. Do you still believe it?

Fields.DialogueText: In my head I know you're right. But it's hard to accept.
But the stories are so much more interesting.
Hm. Perhaps. But this one... it is harder to see now.
*sigh* They say it's rumored he had ties to the Marine Nationale going back before the war. He may have had something to fight for besides gold after all.
But then... what am I fighting for? For Italy? For humanity? I like them both... but neither quite rings true.
Some people go their whole lives never asking. Some ask and never know. I don't think it's something anyone can answer for you.
I'm overhearing radio chatter... a Morgana sighting and they're calling for backup.  We should go. Maybe it's best we keep busy.
All right. I'll start rallying everyone.
When that's done... Capitano, come try some of this wine? It is really good - and you're right, it's no good drinking alone.
@BATTLE
Reports of Morganas in the area.
Prepare to engage.
@BATTLE
*sigh* Coastal patrol is boring.
At least it gives the crew a chance to spend their paychecks. I can't help but notice some of of them rather like spending on you.
Hoho! Well, they do know how to make a lady feel appreciated, that's true.
Oh, I'm having coffee with some of them later. You should join us!
Some Time Later
*GROUP LAUGHTER*
Ah, Capitano, you made it. Sit! See, I told you all we'd have company!

Fields.MenuText: It gets lonely at the top. Good to hang out with other people sometimes.
She badgered me into it... but sounds like you're all having fun.
I wouldn't miss a chance to see your pretty face, Antoniotto.

Fields.DialogueText: Certo! A life alone is a poor life indeed!
Pshh. The Capitano doth protest too much.
Cavolo! Getting forward, aren't we? Haha!
Grace here is from... some little town in England. Scusa, dear - I can never keep them straight.
Ha! But it is kind of a nothing-ville so no one else does either.
Meynard is from the French coast, but he's been a merchant seaman and sailed to the Americas and back.
A few times. Picked up some pirate tales even Antoniotto hasn't heard. There's this one I picked up in New Orleans... about Vincent Gambi's ghost.
Oh, you've told me this one before...
Oh, tell me!
There was a fisherman who lived on the bayou named Louis. And I shouldn't have to explain how that's a hard life and there were times he dreamed of better.
And of course, fisherman talk and legends get passed around, and one of them was that Gambi had buried a treasure hoard on one of the nearby islands.
Finally he got an old Cajun man to tell him that if he went to a certain island under the full moon and looked for a patch of moss that glowed silver, that's where the treasure would be.
But he also told Louis not to go, for Gambi was as viscous as he was in life and would cut the throat of anyone who tried to take it!
Louis took to the swamp anyway and found the muddy little island with nothing but a couple dead trees and the ruins of an old shack and well, there was the silver moss.
And dug down in the spot and believe it or not, he found it! But as soon as he reached down to pick up a silver piece out of the dirt...
There was Gambi! Dripping wet, eyes shining like the moon, pulling out an ivory handled dagger and grinning with menace. Louis ran, praying to all the saints and that got him to his boat.
But he was still clinging to that silver piece. And when his friends came to his house the next day they found him in his boat, throat cut, the silver left in his hand as a warning.
Oh, bravo!
The lure of treasure drives people to dire things, doesn't it?
C'est vrai. They call it greed, but sometimes you realize how they think that it will solve all their problems and you kinda sympathize with them.
(We're coming back into dock again. Can't waste this opportunity...)
Excuse me, Miss... Scherf, was it?
Oh, Captain. Can I help you?
This is a bit... unusual, but when we get docked and we let crew off for R&R, could I speak with you a bit... on land? There's a cafe where a lot of junior officers meet...
Um... Would it be all right if I bring Meynard?
Please do. This is... well, I'll explain when we get there.
Some Time Later
Sorry for not explaining myself better, but I wanted to get away from where Antoniotto might hear us.
Is something wrong?
Not really. But she's been a little... melancholy lately. And I'd like to do something for her.
Ah, so a surprise.
I thought to ask you for help because you're friends. I was hoping you might have some ideas about things she might like.
Ooohhh... are you looking to impress her?

Fields.MenuText: ... Maybe a little bit.
Well, she is an impressive woman.
What? No, no, not like that... exactly...

Fields.DialogueText: Hehe. She does have that effect on people.
She is, isn't she? Even I can see some of the attraction.
You're blushing, Captain. I dare say that's adorable.
Well, she likes all the usual things... liquor, sweets, flowers and such. But really, if you want it to mean something with her, it's got to be jewelry.
I guess that's not a surprise.
Isn't she mad about clothes too?
Oh, no no no no, bad idea. Too many ways to go wrong giving clothes unless you know the lady really well.
But she's shown me her jewelry collection. She can tell you where she got each piece, when and how and what it means to her.
Hm. Grace, you're in gunnery, right?
Aye. Meynard too.
Those gold bangles that keep appearing on the gun barrels...
(snicker) Her idea... but some of us do like helping...
Don't look at me. I'm here for the coffee.
I think I spy some Morganas approaching the dock. Let's deal with them before they touch land.
@BATTLE
(This cafe is pretty nice. It's almost a shame Antoniotto can't come here.)
(Wait, is that...)
Raoul, you scoundrel, have a seat here. Glad to have some time back on land?
Ah, Captain! Yes... and likely more of it to come.
They tell me that to continue on your ship I should formally enlist in the INPF... and, as grateful as I am to you, I don't think that life is for me.

Fields.MenuText: That's understandable. I have trouble imagining you in the uniform.
That's too bad. Antoniotto will miss you.
That's too bad. We'll all miss you.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the sad truth. Plus I still jump at every loud noise.
And I her. But I know she'll understand... she seems to want everyone to be happy.
That's very kind of you. But I think I need this... to sleep at night and not wonder what calamity might befall me next.
I have some savings and I've been reaching out to old contacts. I think there still might be a future as a merchant, one with less chance of ending up at the bottom of the ocean.
Though, I heard the news that the Morganas got Gaspard. So maybe the sea routes will become slightly less treacherous now.
Hm. Raoul, maybe I could still use your help.
I want to get a gift for Antoniotto... jewelry. Something extravagant, maybe something unique. I can hardly look myself when I'm out at sea most of the time...
I follow you. Captain, I would be delighted to help. Let me ask around. I'm certain I can put you in touch with the right people.
Captain? Phone call from your ship. It sounds like you're about to be called out to action.
Figures. Raoul, feel free to stay here... we'll formalize your departure later.
Thank you. It's a much nicer place to hide from Morganas, isn't it?
@BATTLE
Raoul, tesoro! So it's true?
It is. No more adventure for me, but I'm sure I'll stop by and see you when you're in port.
Well, I understand... this will be better for you. But I wish there were something I could do for you before we part.
Maybe there is! I've been telling my friends about you and how you sing. Some of them would like to hear you perform, maybe over dinner.
Truly? Capitano, would that be all right, to have guests?
(Raoul just winked at me. He's up to something.)

Fields.MenuText: Raoul, these are... special friends of yours?
What sort of show are we talking about here?
It sounds like it would be a great opportunity for Antoniotto.

Fields.DialogueText: They are indeed, Captain. I think you would be pleased to meet them.
An intimate gathering, two or three people. You'd be welcome to join.
Indeed, I think it might benefit her very greatly if all goes well.
I think it's a fine idea, then. A few nights from now?
That should work.
Oh, my, this is exciting! I might have to actually... practice!
Captain! We need to get going. There's a Morgana hunt forming up off the peninsula.
And that's my cue to get going. I'll be in touch!
@BATTLE
Pardon my appearance... the wind was fierce on the boat that brought us out this afternoon.
So, while Antoniotto is distracted getting ready, can you tell me what this is all about?
Ah, yes. So I know a jeweler. Custom work. Lovely stuff.
And he has a friend he's invested in. Movie director. Exile from Italy. Looking for a break. He is, shall we say, looking for talent.
The short of it: those are our guests tonight.
And you think Antoniotto might be the sort of "talent" he's looking for?
I am a bit biased. But you know, she is infatuated with American theater and movies. This could be an exciting opportunity for her.

Fields.MenuText: As infatuated with performing as she is with pirate adventures?
She did say once that she dreamed of performing for crowds.
Well I guess if it gets us to the treasure, so to speak...

Fields.DialogueText: I can't say... you might know her better.
Then it's perfect. If this works out, everyone will benefit.
Eye on the prize, huh? Still, I think we all might enjoy this arrangement.
Excuse me, Captain. The meeting will need to be postponed. Antoniotto sent me down to warn you that the alarm is about to go off and there's probably going to be a fight.
¡Maldición! Not this again and not now!
Will you be all right?
We have a comfortable room with coffee and brandy. I will try to hold myself together for appearance's sake...
*ALARM*
Yrgh! ... I'm all right... I'm all right...
@BATTLE
And while they probably couldn't pay Antoniotto in cash for her time... well, they might be amenable to letting her keep some of the jewelry her character wears. A necklace, perhaps?
Captain, quite a number of Morganas are approaching.
Where is Antoniotto?
Sono qui, Capitano. Ready for battle.
@BATTLE
Gentlemen, we're in the clear now. I'm sorry you had to go through that.
Well, we lived... it was easier with these two with me.
Captain, these are my associates: Lavi LoBue and Ebeneezer Sarracino.
Hmmph. A pleasure, Captain.
Capitano! Shalom! We go through rough seas and rough times together. Come sit with us, you must be tired after all that.
So where is la Bella?
Catching a breather and fussing over her appearance. She'll join us shortly. Shall I send for anything? Cigarettes? More brandy?
Some Time Later
Are you my love? Then life's begun for me...Are you my Love? The moon and sun for me...
Fantastico...
Eh. She has enthusiasm and a pretty face.

Fields.MenuText: Her face is prettier than her voice...
I've found her voice very... seductive.
She's a radiant siren. You won't convince me she's less than perfect.

Fields.DialogueText: But what a voice!
I can see why. Popular with the crew, I bet.
High praise, Capitano! How many hearts might she win?
... Are you a dream that's overtaken me? If you're a dream then don't awaken me... Are you... my love... my sweet?
*APPLAUSE*
Brava, brava! Antoniotto, you are a wonder!
Oh, thank you! Capitano, would you hand me that drink? I need to sit for a bit.
Antoniotto, have you ever thought of being in the movies?
Me? Well it has crossed my mind. I like to think I take a bit after Jean Harlow, rest her soul.
Ah, yes, the blond angel, Miss Harlow, taken from this world too soon.
I have always wanted to make the sort of movies they make in Hollywood, the sort you can't make in Italy anymore. And it is dangerous for people like Ebeneezer and I to stand out these days.
But we have some money put aside, and connections. Antoniotto, how would you like to be a movie star?
I... I never imagined... Capitano, can we do that?
It would have to be done on the ship - and I think both Rome and the Fleet would have to sign off on the scripts. I have no idea if that's possible...
Anything is possible! Give me a week or two. I know you will need permission from your Command, and I think I know how to sell it to them.
I can't believe Command is on board with this...
Lavi sold them on the propaganda angle. Publicity for the Joint Fleet, some good light thrown onto the Italians...
It's a tight schedule, of course. He will bring the rest of the cast and film crew from the mainland; the ship crew get to be extras.
But we don't get out of regular duties either. So if we run into Morganas... Captain, how is it you're on board with this?

Fields.MenuText: I only got the full details when the Admiralty was telling me how exciting the opportunity was.
This is for Antoniotto... I know it will mean a lot to her.
It's a chance for all of us to be famous... doesn't that excite you, Davros?

Fields.DialogueText: So we're committed.
It seems like another flight of fancy to me...
Not really. But it doesn't look like I get much say.
Antoniotto, what do you think of all this?
I'm... still stunned. I can think of some other Belles who will be very jealous.
You'll be fantastic, my dear.
Captain - I have to get back ashore, but can I have a private word before I go?
Captain, I want to apologize for Ebaneezer... he's a very gruff man and I realize he may have come off as unfriendly.
But I think he was really quite taken with Antoniotto. He sent along these design sketches to show you.
A necklace? Raoul, that is exquisite.
I quite like how it resembles a stylized anchor... and he was thinking engraved white gold with sea-blue stones.
I'm glad you approve. And now I really must be going...
Captain! Mist approaching on the harbor!
...in a great hurry!
@BATTLE
That's my cue to get back to work. Captain?
I'll meet you on the bridge in a minute.
Capitano! Have you seen the latest dispatches?
Lavi sent on a copy of the film script!
And?
He's written pirates into it!

Fields.MenuText: More pirates. Why am I not surprised?
Well, it's better than running into the real thing again.
A bit of swashbuckling... I could get behind that.

Fields.DialogueText: It's almost as if it's been written for me, isn't it?
More adventure, less danger... sounds perfect, doesn't it?
Oh, I'm glad you like it too!
Now I'm excited about this!
You were excited before, weren't you?
Huh? Oh... certo, certo! Maybe a little nervous too. But now I'm really excited!
Capitano, maybe they'll let you be in it too! Maybe you can be competition for the romantic lead!
Errr...
Haha, I'm kidding. Look at you blushing through. How funny!
Oh, look, Morganas incoming again. You know what, I don't care! Have at ye, scurvy dogs!
@BATTLE
"Gino, my dear, you'll never believe what I saw!"
"Was it the ghost ship?"
Knock knock.
Ah, Captain, what do you need? We're in the middle of a read-through.
Your scenery materials are blocking a corridor. We can't have that when the shooting starts.
Ah, my apologies. Getting started, everything is always so messy.
Well, it's a safety hazard to anyone needing to get though in a hurry - and a "hurry" around here is usually already a life or death thing. I need it dealt with now.
Of course. I will track down my set guy.
Good - if that didn't work my next plan was to let Davros at him.
Meynard, you're involved in this?
Just helping Antoniotto. Lavi's leading man is down with seasickness.
Have you read the script, Capitano?
I haven't had time. What's it about?
Well my character is named Mariella, she's a singer on a passenger ship. Her love interest, Gino, is a stowaway... a war refugee... and they caught him and put him to work.
They're sailing through the Caribbean for Panama and there's all these rumors of an old pirate ghost ship haunting the seas and long story short, they're true.
Also, there's a thief and his gang on board, he's descended from some 18th century pirates, they're planning a heist using the ghost ship story as cover...
Honestly, it might take me another couple reads to really understand it all.

Fields.MenuText: Uh, did Lavi write this script?
Sounds like the usual Hollywood pulp, I guess.
Sounds like a lot of fun.

Fields.DialogueText: As a matter of fact, he did...
Nothing wrong with that! Mind, people do gossip about my tastes...
I think so too...but it's an awful lot to take on...
Oh dear... I think we were likely to get interrupted anyway.
Morganas? I sure hope Lavi found his "set guy."
Point me at the mess, Captain. I'll scrounge up some help.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Psst. What are they up to?
More rehearsals. Antoniotto's never really done acting before.
"Gino, I'm afraid! What if they find out you know their plan?"
Bah! I'm sorry, I know that didn't sound right...
Antoniotto, darling, you are so tense!
Isn't Marietta supposed to be tense?
Not like that. Darling, it's like when you sing, you feel the emotion in the words, yes? And it comes out in the song... this is the same.
Think of the audience too... you showed me you know how to work an audience! Flaunt your assets, keep that core of confidence wrapped around you!
You are a gorgeous lady... play to that! Wrap them around your little finger!
But I've never had to think about it before.
You are nervous. Relax and it will come to you.
Now, I need a cigarette and you need a moment. Let's take five, everyone.
Grace, tell me straight, how terrible was I?
I think he's right - you're just nervous and frustrated. Captain, can you think of anything?

Fields.MenuText: Like he said, it's like when you sing. You just have to remember that feeling.
It's like when you're telling pirate tales to the crew. Think of it like that.
It's a little like lying... like that time you were covering for that drunk midshipman...

Fields.DialogueText: I can try. But I don't know, something feels different about this.
Well, I guess that's kind of like acting...
Hey, now! ... But I guess you have a point.
But all that stuff I do for friends. I know how to be comfortable around them.
...oh? Oh no. Damn Morganas! Incazzato! I don't need this now...
@BATTLE
Sailor, there should be a winch stored in here! Where is it?
Uhm. I think the movie crew borrowed it to hoist something.
Madonna! Find it and get it back! The cleanup crew needs it. Antoniotto! Where are you going?
With Lavi. We're recording the songs for the film.
Argh! Movie this, movie that... does anyone realize we're running a warship here?
Some Time Later
*sigh* At least she looks like she's enjoying herself...
This is more her element, yes. It would be nice to hear her but it had to be a soundproofed room.
It's only been a week and they've turned this ship topsy-turvy.
And have you seen those costumes for the extras? They want our young ladies to parade around in those necklines!

Fields.MenuText: It's no use being prudish. That's the movie business for you.
Well, maybe they could stand to wear something under them...
Um... yes, I've seen them. And a bit more...

Fields.DialogueText: And the world is poorer for it in my opinion.
It would be a compromise at least...
I hope that red creeping across your face is embarrassment and not something else...
*sigh* I'm venting. Maybe it will turn out all right and all this will pass. But it still seems reckless and silly.
Sometimes reckless and silly pays off. Haven't you ever had a dream for your life, Davros?
Captain, I took over my father's fishing fleet after he died because there was no one else who could do it. I was fifteen. I haven't had time for dreams since.
We have to focus on present realities. For now, this is one of them. But I worry, Captain...
*ALARM*
You'll have to put those worries aside for a moment. We have company.
@BATTLE
Captain? May I speak with you?
Something to drink while we chat?
No, thank you.
It's Antoniotto... and I feel safe saying so because she's distracted with filming.
Is she still struggling with the acting?
Not so much... she's kind of compensating for her nerves by overacting, but she's at least presentable for the camera now.
And if you ask, she'll tell you everything's fine. But... I'm not so sure.
Call it woman's intuition, maybe. She's distracted a lot, she spends most of her time either fighting, filming or trying to rest from the strain of those two. And maybe not enough of that last one.

Fields.MenuText: Speaking from personal experience, Antoniotto doesn't really listen when told she's working herself too hard.
Do you think something else is bothering her?
Do I need to have a talk with Lavi about it?

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know.
I suspect it, but I can't be sure.
I don't know if that would help. I don't even know what you could say.
*ALARM*
Dammit.
I'll keep an eye out. We'll talk later.
*ALARM*
What terrible timing. Allow us to deal with the Morganas to avoid any distractions.
@BATTLE
So this is Command's analysis of the latest Morgana activity in the area. There's been a spike of incidents within our 100-mile radius.
It's a target rich environment for them - busy neutral port and all.
Mmm.
Antoniotto, are you even listening?
100 miles, more Morganas than usual. I hear you just fine.
Then maybe look at the map and offer suggestions instead of staring out the porthole.
Hold your fire, Lieutenant.
I might be more interested if we weren't still stuck on damn coastal patrol!
The security of this port is vital to INPF operations. It's our duty-
To hell with you and your duty! It's all you ever seem to think about and I'm sick of it!
Young lady, I haven't come this far in life to be belittled by a gussied-up-
Enough!
You're both frazzled, I understand that. But, Davros, I need you to take a breath. And Antoniotto...

Fields.MenuText: You've been all out of sorts lately. I'm worried about you.
You've been working too hard. I want you to take the rest of the day to rest.
I need you to focus. I know the film business is hectic but the Morganas are still our first priority.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, has Grace been talking to you? Capitano, I'm fine.
I am not some delicate flower that needs tending! I say when I've had enough!
Then what did you bring that bastard director in for?
But-! You...! Antoniotto, this is not helpful!
Then stay out of my way and let me handle it.
Aaaand there are Morganas coming in. Good. I need to shoot something...
@BATTLE
"That bastard...?" Okay, what's the problem with LoBue, and how can I fix it?
It's fine! I'm dealing with it!
*ALARM*
Report, Davros!
Almost in range, Captain...
@BATTLE
All right, all clear! Get the cameras back in and someone pry Gino out from under the bed!
Antoniotto? ... Oh, Captain, have you seen Antoniotto?
Not since the fight ended. Lavi, listen, I need to talk to--
Captain, I am running out of time on this shoot! If the ship isn't on fire I don't want to hear it! Antoniotto, where are you?
Here.
Hurry up, darling, We need to get moving! You, get that light set properly!
Some Time Later
"Listen, Gino, darling, I don't care if you think it's too dangerous. I don't care if--"
Cut! Antoniotto, that's not how the line goes! Gino is trying to protect you and--
Why does Mariella need protecting? She's a perfectly capable woman!
But Gino is your love!
He doesn't seem so great to me!
Che palle! I don't have time for this! Stick to the script!
The script is terrible!
I've had enough of this damn script for today and I'm getting pretty fed up with you!
Gah! Divas! We can't wait for her... move on to the next scene!
Captain, you know her better; she will calm down eventually, right?
Right now I'm not making any promises. Antoniotto!
(Alone on the bow deck again...)
Antoniotto...

Fields.MenuText: Antoniotto, please. You aren't acting like yourself and I don't know what to do.
This is getting out of control. You seriously need to calm down.
Looking for something to shoot?

Fields.DialogueText: We're heading for that radio sighting that we picked up a few hours ago. The Morgana mist should be showing up on the horizon now.
Radio... that call was from out of our patrol zone! I didn't authorize...!
I heard no order. I just... "forgot" to turn around. Very distracted by the filming.
... Okay. We now officially have to have a conversation.
*ALARM*
For crying out loud!
@BATTLE
Antoniotto...
I'm going to my room.
Stay right here! That. Is. An. Order!
Antoniotto, something is wrong that you aren't telling me and I can't keep running the ship like this! For the love of all that's holy, tell me what--
I DON'T KNOW!
*gasp* I don't know. This movie... I should be having the time of my life, a chance to be a star, a dream come true. And you and Raoul were so eager.
And everyone else seems so happy for me. So why am I not happy? Why does everything feel so wrong?
... *sniff* Can I go now? Please?
Lavi, get your crew and gear off the deck! This wind is a storm front and we can't sail around it!
Commander, I don't have time to stop and our chance to shoot outdoors has been limited! We will go in when it gets too strong!
Absolutely not! The ship will be pitching in the waves and there will be men and gear flying all over the place!
Well, tell that to the Captain! I'm not the only one with something to lose if this project fails!
What do you mean?

Fields.MenuText: Don't use me as a shield, Lavi! I'm not risking lives for this!
Davros is right. Get off the deck, Lavi!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not asking for that, Captain! But if you want that gift for your lady...
Gah! It's just a little weather! And think about what this is paying for!
Oh, no, you don't. You're not holding some deal over my head when there is risk to my ship and crew!
Capitano--!
I've staked nearly everything I have on this project! I have borrowed money!
Look, the weather is picking up! There's a fog rolling in!
I have nearly 250 people on this ship to think of! Your creditors are not my problem!
CAPITANO! This isn't fog!
(A Morgana shouts something predictably garbled from way too close.)
You!
Merda! The ghost ship... what is that woman? Sal, roll the camera! Get a shot of that!
@BATTLE
Enough!
Captain, I am done with this.
I don't know what you did to get into this mess and I'm not sure I want to, but we are getting out of it.

Fields.MenuText: I want out of it too but I'm stuck. Command is backing this.
We've gone too far to back out now. And we have Command's approval...
I take your point, but watch your tone.

Fields.DialogueText: Or are you stuck because you don't want to give up whatever Lavi promised you?
Ridiculous. And if I ever meet who in Command approved this I mean to give them a piece of my mind.
You think the problem is my tone?
I've sent a complaint to Command, to people I know will listen.
You went over my head?
I had to! We can't keep running the ship like this!
Antoniotto is being driven half-mad, Lavi has forgotten all care for safety and sanity, the crew is getting swept up in the chaos...
And first and foremost, We. Are. A. Warship! Not a film set!
Captain, I've been running ships half my life. But when fate gave me command of the fishing fleet I was just as unprepared as you must have felt when Antoniotto chose you as her Captain.
Not very long ago, for me to be commander of a naval ship would have been unthinkable. But when the INPF was formed, I asked for a commission and they recognized my ability.
And it so happened there was an Italian ship in need of a first officer and a headstrong, wayward Belle whom they saw as needing a firm hand to balance her hotheaded ways...
... and possibly the follies of an inexperienced captain.
Captain, I am here to back you up. The relationship between you and Antoniotto is strong, and vital to the well-being of this ship.
But you have lost control of the situation. And I am putting my foot down.
*ALARM*
*sigh*
@BATTLE
And I would respect that more if you'd had this conversation with me *before* running off to some random admiral.
Capitano, I believe this will be a quick skirmish.
Well, then, let's get to it.
@BATTLE
Everyone, I have an announcement. This came to us over the radio before the fight.
*ahem* "All movie production aboard the Antoniotto Usodimare is to immediately cease. Film crew and materials are to be returned to their origin port where they will disembark.
Furthermore, Lavi LoBue is to report to the port command post of the INPF to give an account of his conduct and discuss probable termination of his contract.
... Che palle.
*sigh* And that's that.
Hmmph.
... Davros, we have a problem to resolve.
I suggest you be honest with her. I get the impression both of you have been something less than that.
So this is all down to Raoul. Why am I not surprised?
You know what? Never mind. Obviously this plan has now come to naught.
Obviously so.
Not what I meant.
For the record, the deal Raoul arranged with LoBue was that Antoniotto could keep a necklace when the filming was done, in lieu of a salary.
I don't think she ever knew about it. It's not like she ever asked about getting paid.
I will add that the necklace-as-payment thing was signed off on by Command. Admiral Turro was tickled by the idea. It was not a bribe.
I will also say that Mr. LoBue and his team obliged with every safety regulation and removed every misplaced prop or set piece within minutes of being asked.
By the standards of ship-based filmmaking, which in this bizarre war of ours is apparently a thing, they were extremely efficient and well-behaved.
Captain...
I'm still talking.
Now. Is it your contention that I jeopardized the crew?
I... thought so at the time.
I gathered that. Because your experience with a fishing fleet makes you a better captain than me.
Good. You're learning.
Davros, you're brave, and you're profoundly competent, and there are times when you are an absolutely vital counterweight to certain other members of this crew who are given to flights of fancy.
But you went behind my back without first making the best damn case you could make to my face. As God is my witness, if you ever do that again, I'm kicking you off my ship.
Do you understand me?
Yes, Captain. I... apologize. Profusely.
Good.
That said, LoBue wouldn't have left the ship if I hadn't also signed off on it.
But...
Yeah, again, it was the "behind my back" part I objected to, Davros.
You're dismissed.
I... Captain, may I say something?
Please.
You've kept us alive when I don't think many others could've. That's just a fact. If I were in charge this ship would be at the bottom of the Red Sea.
I've been an ass, but don't think I don't know your worth.
Noted.
I also think you'd save yourself a lot of grief if you'd just ask that girl out.
Okay, *now* you're dismissed.
Captain.
Antoniotto, don't rush off. We need to talk.
Is that an order?
Please don't force me to make it one.
... Bene.
Sit. I'll get you a drink if you want one.
Just... tell me how it went wrong. Don't hold anything back even if you aren't sure of it. I need to hear your side.
... When Lavi offered the role to me, I didn't know how to feel. Flattered, yes. Excited... I don't know.
But you were involved and so was Raoul... you two set this up, didn't you? I was so caught up I don't know if I realized...
Yes. We both thought it would be a good thing for you. But you could have said no.
I trusted you. I got the sense you were expecting me to say yes... and I respected you enough that I didn't want to let you down.
But it was all wrong. Wrong script, wrong character, wrong for me. This type of performing, it's not me.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't one type of performing more or less the same as another?
Embarrasingly enough, I was trying really hard to be supportive because I thought it was what *you* wanted.
Well... you got to sing, at least?

Fields.DialogueText: I would have thought so too. It's different when you actually try it.
I thought it was too. But the dream didn't survive contact with reality, I guess.
Well... that bit was fun. But the rest...
I admit, part of the problem... I didn't want to admit any of this to myself either until I couldn't avoid it anymore.
And by that point... I was trying to get through by telling myself I was doing this for you.
But that... that was wrong too, wasn't it?
I... I need time to deal with this. I'll keep doing my job but this isn't going to get better all at once.
I understand.
Do you, Capitano? Because I sure don't.
Well, I think I understand that the best thing I can do is not to be an ass. So I'll give it a shot.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capitano, the crew needs to prepare for battle. I sense Morganas close by.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
(Back into port again...)
I got your note...
Yes... sit down, Captain. I've taken the liberty of ordering our drinks... on me, this time.
I'm sure you've heard how it all crashed and burned. I'm sorry I dragged you into it.
Don't be. I was as excited as you. I just hate that we made Antoniotto so unhappy.

Fields.MenuText: I really thought she would like this... I guess I don't know her as well as I thought.
Not you. Me. I was the one in a position to stop this before it got as bad as it did.
I was just so sure that if we kept going it would all work out in the end... and now I may have ruined our friendship.

Fields.DialogueText: The road to hell and good intentions... I know how that goes.
I think you meant well, even if your priorities weren't quite straight.
If you are willing to admit it, there is still a chance to mend it. But it's up to you...and her.
However, I didn't summon you to land to dwell on bad news. It has not been a complete disaster.
One, Lavi won't be making the film he planned but he has enough footage for a one-reel. He can shop it around, maybe get a sponsor to go to America and hone his craft.
Two, he got film footage of a Morgana. That's big for the INPF. They're willing to pay him something just for that.
Three, Ebeneezer is feeling generous. He can't cut us the same deal we were going to get, but between the money you've put up and some unexpected windfall on my end, I can deliver you this.
The necklace... Raoul... I don't know if I can...
You can. Let her get something good out of this.
Then you should be with me when she gets it.
No. Captain, I see how you care for her. I have felt my heart flutter for her, but she is a woman of the sea and the sea is not for me.
A statement like this can not but mean something. You may mention me and my gratitude when you give it, but I leave the statement to you.
Raoul... thank you. I think I have an idea how to give it to her too...
Antoniotto...
Capitano.
... *sigh*
Antoniotto, I was a fool. With Raoul's help, I wanted to do something nice for you and it ballooned out of control. I did wrong by you and I'm sorry.
*sigh* I know you meant well. I wanted it to work too.
Maybe you can't just give someone else their dreams. Too many ways for it to go wrong.
I want to make it up to you. Starting with dinner tonight. Me, your close friends and some special surprises.
And wine?
If you wish.
Bene...
But you may need to tell the galley to hold the canapés. Incoming...
@BATTLE
I see the setting for dinner and ooh, you've even got little candles, but what's this? A piano?
Lavi's people left it behind. I got it moved and Grace told me how to get it in tune.
Grace, you play?
A little. Get the party soused enough and I play great!
Maybe the silver screen isn't for you, but we all know how you love performing for your friends. We would hate for you to lose that.
So later, if and only if you want, it would be nice to hear you sing a little.
Heh. You all are sly little foxes. You're lucky I like you.
But you're smiling, and that's good to see. So...?
Wine first. Then we'll see.
When you're dancing the waltz, you must not lose your head... When you're dancing the waltz, lose your shyness instead...
(whispering) Mmph. Scuse me...need to get up...
Davros? Problem?
Radio call-out. I know this is important to you, though, and we've got distance to cover to get there. Figure thirty minutes before we need you.
Thank you.
Captain?
Yes?
Just... be good to each other. And try not to put the ship through so much hell again.

Fields.MenuText: I'll be good.
Heh. This is Antoniotto we're talking about... no promises.
Oh, I expect we'll get into a lot of trouble, but I'll try to spare you the worst of it.

Fields.DialogueText: Sure you will. But I'll settle for good effort.
Point. But at least be good to her.
*sigh* I'll take what I can get.
Remember, thirty minutes.
@BATTLE
Whew! We were having so much fun we almost missed our call to battle!
But... that was a good show. Grazie... I needed that.
I'm glad. But there's one more thing... I have another confession.
This whole mess... part of it was that I wanted to get you a real treasure.
Again, I'm sorry for all of it. But Raoul was able to track down... well, I was going to call it a gift, but you definitely earned it.
So this is thanks to him, with his gratitude... and from me, from my heart. Here.
Oooh, you got me a box! Heh... oh... oh!
Oh, Capitano! I... you... does this mean...?
You like it?
It's beautiful! But you...!  You...? Me? Do I...?
Oh, this is too much... I need to find a Morgana... I mean a mirror!
*giggle* I think you have her attention.
*ALARM*
Morganas have horrible timing!
@BATTLE
Hummm-mmm-m-mmm...mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm...
Drinking alone on the bow deck again?
Not exactly. I expected you to show up eventually.
It is a nice sunset, isn't it?
Mm-hm.
... Capitano?
Hm?
Are you a dream that's overtaken me? If you're a dream, then don't awaken me...
My heart must know if you'll deceive... are you my love, my sweet?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know if this is love...but I treasure you greatly.
It's maybe not what you dreamed...but my love is real.
(Smile playfully and say nothing.)

Fields.DialogueText: Mmm. It is a different kind of treasure, but maybe no less in riches.
Heh. Don't they say in all the songs that love is like a dream?
Heh. You sly fox.
I warn you, Capitano... I am not one to stay still for long. I am, after all, a Navigatori. And if you wander in turn, well, I will try not to have too many hard feelings.
But I promise that when you are with me, it will be one hell of an adventure.
Then let's have an adventure together. A toast... to the future.
